option.value: {"C:/Users/User/AndroidStudioProjects/MyMovies":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/adapters/TrailerAdapter.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of a `TrailerAdapter` class, which is a custom adapter for a `RecyclerView` that displays a list of movie trailers.\\n\\n`TrailerAdapter`: A custom adapter for a `RecyclerView` that displays a list of movie trailers.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: Creates a new `TrailerViewHolder` instance for each item in the `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: Binds the data for a specific trailer to the corresponding `TrailerViewHolder`.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: Returns the number of trailers in the adapter.\\n\\n`onTrailerClickListener`: An interface that defines a method for handling clicks on a trailer item.\\n\\n`TrailerViewHolder`: A view holder class that represents a single trailer item in the `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`setTrailers`: Sets the list of trailers to be displayed in the adapter and notifies the `RecyclerView` of the data change.\\n\\n`setOnTrailerClickListener`: Sets the `onTrailerClickListener` for the adapter, which will be called when a trailer item is clicked.\",\"/.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a heading for a document titled \\\"estovierailers\\\".\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/FavouriteActivity.java\":\"This file is an Android activity class that displays a list of favorite movies. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`FavouriteActivity`: This class is responsible for displaying a list of favorite movies and handling user interactions with the list.\\n\\n`onOptionsItemSelected`: This function handles the selection of menu items, allowing the user to navigate to the main activity or the favorite activity.\\n\\n`onCreateOptionsMenu`: This function inflates the main menu and adds it to the activity.\\n\\n`onCreate`: This function sets up the activity, initializes the RecyclerView, and observes the favorite movies in the MainViewModel. It also sets up a click listener for the movie posters, which opens the DetailActivity when a poster is clicked.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/adapters/MovieAdapter.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `MovieAdapter` class, which is a custom adapter for a `RecyclerView` that displays a list of movies. The adapter manages the data and presentation of the movie items in the `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`MovieAdapter`: A custom adapter for a `RecyclerView` that displays a list of movies.\\n\\n`onPosterClickListener`: An interface that defines a method for handling clicks on movie posters.\\n\\n`onReachEndListener`: An interface that defines a method for handling when the user reaches the end of the list of movies.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: Creates a new `MovieViewHolder` instance for the `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: Binds the data for a specific movie to the corresponding `MovieViewHolder`.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: Returns the number of movies in the adapter.\\n\\n`MovieViewHolder`: A view holder class that represents a single movie item in the `RecyclerView`.\\n\\n`clear`: Removes all movies from the adapter.\\n\\n`setMovies`: Sets the list of movies in the adapter.\\n\\n`addMovies`: Adds a list of movies to the adapter.\\n\\n`getMovies`: Returns the list of movies in the adapter.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/adapters/ReviewAdapter.java\":\"`ReviewAdapter`: A class that extends `RecyclerView.Adapter` to display a list of movie reviews.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder`: Creates a new `ReviewViewHolder` instance with the layout defined in `reviews_item.xml`.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder`: Binds the review data to the views in the `ReviewViewHolder`.\\n\\n`getItemCount`: Returns the number of reviews in the list.\\n\\n`setReviews`: Sets the list of reviews and notifies the adapter of the data change.\\n\\n`ReviewViewHolder`: A static inner class that extends `RecyclerView.ViewHolder` and holds references to the views in the `reviews_item.xml` layout.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/utils/NetworkUtils.java\":\"This file contains utility functions for making network requests to the TheMovieDB API and parsing the JSON responses.\\n\\n`NetworkUtils`: A utility class that provides methods for building URLs and making network requests to the TheMovieDB API.\\n\\n`buildURLtoReviews(int id)`: Builds a URL to fetch reviews for a movie with the given ID.\\n`buildURLtoVideos(int id)`: Builds a URL to fetch videos for a movie with the given ID.\\n`buildURL(int sortBy, int page)`: Builds a URL to fetch a list of movies based on the specified sort order and page number.\\n`getJSONForReviews(int id)`: Fetches the JSON data for reviews of a movie with the given ID.\\n`getJSONForVidios(int id)`: Fetches the JSON data for videos of a movie with the given ID.\\n`getJSONFromNetwork(int sortBy, int page)`: Fetches the JSON data for a list of movies based on the specified sort order and page number.\\n\\n`JSONLoader`: An `AsyncTaskLoader` subclass that loads JSON data from a URL in the background.\\n`onStartLoadingListener`: An interface that defines a callback for when the `JSONLoader` starts loading data.\\n\\n`JSONLoadTask`: An `AsyncTask` subclass that loads JSON data from a URL in the background.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/utils/JSONUtils.java\":\"This file contains utility functions for parsing JSON data related to movies, reviews, and trailers. It does not contain any classes.\\n\\n`getReviewsFromJSON`: Extracts a list of `Reviews` objects from a JSON object containing movie review data.\\n\\n`getTrailersFromJSON`: Extracts a list of `Trailer` objects from a JSON object containing movie trailer data.\\n\\n`getMoviesFromJSON`: Extracts a list of `Movie` objects from a JSON object containing movie data.\\n\\nThe file also defines several constants related to the structure of the JSON data and the URLs for accessing movie posters and trailers.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/example/mymovies/ExampleUnitTest.java\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test method. It does not contain any other classes or functions.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: This is a unit test class that tests the basic functionality of the application.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: This test method checks that the addition operation (2 + 2) is correctly implemented and returns the expected result of 4.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a simple example of a unit test for an Android application, which can be used as a starting point for writing more comprehensive tests.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/database/MainViewModel.java\":\"This file contains the `MainViewModel` class and several inner classes that interact with a `MovieDataBase` to manage movies and favorite movies.\\n\\n`MainViewModel`: A ViewModel class that provides data and methods for managing movies and favorite movies.\\n\\n`getFavoriteMovies()`: Returns a LiveData object containing a list of favorite movies.\\n`getMovieById(int movieId)`: Returns a `Movie` object with the specified ID.\\n`getFavoriteMovieById(int movieId)`: Returns a `FavoriteMovie` object with the specified ID.\\n`deleteAllMovie()`: Deletes all movies from the database.\\n`InsertMovie(Movie movie)`: Inserts a new movie into the database.\\n`DeleteMovie(Movie movie)`: Deletes the specified movie from the database.\\n`InsertFavoriteMovie(FavoriteMovie movie)`: Inserts a new favorite movie into the database.\\n`DeleteFavoriteMovie(FavoriteMovie movie)`: Deletes the specified favorite movie from the database.\\n`getAllMovies()`: Returns a LiveData object containing a list of all movies.\\n\\nThe inner classes (`DeleteTask`, `InsertFavoriteMovieTask`, `DeleteFavoriteMovieTask`, `InsertMovieTask`, `DeleteMovieTask`, `GetMovieTask`, and `GetFavoriteMovieTask`) are all AsyncTask subclasses that perform database operations in the background.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/database/Trailer.java\":\"`Trailer`: A class that represents a movie trailer, with properties for the trailer key and name.\\n\\n`getKey()`: Returns the key of the trailer.\\n`setKey(String key)`: Sets the key of the trailer.\\n`getName()`: Returns the name of the trailer.\\n`setName(String name)`: Sets the name of the trailer.\\n`Trailer(String key, String name)`: Constructs a new `Trailer` object with the given key and name.\\n\\nThis file defines a `Trailer` class that represents a movie trailer, with properties for the trailer key and name, and corresponding getter and setter methods.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/database/Movie.java\":\"This file defines a `Movie` class that represents a movie entity in a database. The class has several properties that store information about the movie, such as its ID, title, overview, poster path, and release date. The class also has methods to get and set these properties.\\n\\n`Movie`: A class that represents a movie entity in a database, with properties such as ID, title, overview, poster path, and release date.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the ID of the movie.\\n`getVoteCount()`: Returns the vote count of the movie.\\n`getTitle()`: Returns the title of the movie.\\n`getOriginalTitle()`: Returns the original title of the movie.\\n`getOverview()`: Returns the overview of the movie.\\n`getPosterPath()`: Returns the poster path of the movie.\\n`getBigPosterPath()`: Returns the big poster path of the movie.\\n`getBackdropPath()`: Returns the backdrop path of the movie.\\n`getVoteAverage()`: Returns the vote average of the movie.\\n`getReleaseDate()`: Returns the release date of the movie.\\n`setId(int id)`: Sets the ID of the movie.\\n`setVoteCount(int voteCount)`: Sets the vote count of the movie.\\n`setTitle(String title)`: Sets the title of the movie.\\n`setOriginalTitle(String originalTitle)`: Sets the original title of the movie.\\n`setOverview(String overview)`: Sets the overview of the movie.\\n`setPosterPath(String posterPath)`: Sets the poster path of the movie.\\n`setBigPosterPath(String bigPosterPath)`: Sets the big poster path of the movie.\\n`setBackdropPath(String backdropPath)`: Sets the backdrop path of the movie.\\n`setVoteAverage(double voteAverage)`: Sets the vote average of the movie.\\n`setReleaseDate(String releaseDate)`: Sets the release date of the movie.\\n`Movie(int uniqueId, int id, int voteCount, String title, String originalTitle, String overview, String posterPath, String bigPosterPath, String backdropPath, double voteAverage, String releaseDate)`: Constructor that initializes all the properties of the movie.\\n`getUniqueId()`: Returns the unique ID of the movie.\\n`setUniqueId(int uniqueId)`: Sets the unique ID of the movie.\\n`Movie(int id, int voteCount, String title, String originalTitle, String overview, String posterPath, String bigPosterPath, String backdropPath, double voteAverage, String releaseDate)`: Constructor that initializes all the properties of the movie, except for the unique ID.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/database/MovieDataBase.java\":\"`MovieDataBase`: This class is an abstract class that extends `RoomDatabase` and represents the database for the movie application.\\n\\n`getInstance(Context context)`: This function is a singleton method that returns an instance of the `MovieDataBase` class, creating a new instance if it doesn\\u0027t already exist.\\n\\n`movieDao()`: This function is an abstract method that returns an instance of the `MovieDao` interface, which provides access to the database operations for the movie and favorite movie entities.\\n\\nThis file sets up the Room database for the movie application, including the database name, version, and the entities that are part of the database. It also provides a singleton instance of the database that can be accessed throughout the application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/database/Reviews.java\":\"`Reviews`: A class that represents a movie review, containing an author and the review content.\\n\\n`getAuthor()`: Returns the author of the review.\\n`setAuthor(String author)`: Sets the author of the review.\\n`getContent()`: Returns the content of the review.\\n`setContent(String content)`: Sets the content of the review.\\n`Reviews(String author, String content)`: Constructs a new `Reviews` object with the given author and content.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/DetailActivity.java\":\"This file appears to be an Android application that displays details of a movie, including its trailers and reviews. It also allows the user to add the movie to their favorites list. Here\\u0027s a list of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`DetailActivity`: An activity that displays the details of a movie, including its trailers and reviews, and allows the user to add the movie to their favorites list.\\n\\n`onOptionsItemSelected`: A function that handles the selection of menu items in the `DetailActivity`.\\n\\n`onCreateOptionsMenu`: A function that creates the menu options for the `DetailActivity`.\\n\\n`onCreate`: A function that initializes the `DetailActivity` and sets up the necessary views and data.\\n\\n`onClickChangeFavorite`: A function that is called when the user clicks the \\\"Add to Favorites\\\" button, and adds or removes the movie from the user\\u0027s favorites list.\\n\\n`setFavoriteMovie`: A function that sets the state of the \\\"Add to Favorites\\\" button based on whether the movie is currently in the user\\u0027s favorites list.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/MainActivity.java\":\"This file is the main activity of the \\\"MyMovies\\\" Android application. It handles the display of movie posters, sorting options, and navigation to the favorite movies activity. Here\\u0027s a list of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity that displays a list of movies and allows the user to sort them by popularity or top-rated.\\n\\n`onOptionsItemSelected`: Handles the selection of menu items, allowing the user to navigate to the main activity or the favorite movies activity.\\n\\n`onCreateOptionsMenu`: Inflates the main menu options.\\n\\n`getColumnCount`: Calculates the number of columns to display in the movie poster grid based on the device\\u0027s screen size.\\n\\n`onCreate`: Initializes the activity, sets up the movie adapter, and observes changes in the movie database.\\n\\n`onClickSetPopularity`: Sets the sorting method to popularity.\\n\\n`onClickSetTopRated`: Sets the sorting method to top-rated.\\n\\n`setMethodOfSort`: Updates the UI and downloads movie data based on the selected sorting method.\\n\\n`downloadData`: Initiates the download of movie data from the network.\\n\\n`onCreateLoader`: Creates a JSON loader to fetch movie data from the network.\\n\\n`onLoadFinished`: Processes the downloaded movie data, updates the database, and updates the movie adapter.\\n\\n`onLoaderReset`: Handles the reset of the JSON loader.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/example/mymovies/ExampleInstrumentedTest.java\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for the \\\"MyMovies\\\" Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that verifies the application\\u0027s package name.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and tests the application\\u0027s context.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test method checks that the application\\u0027s package name is \\\"com.example.mymovies\\\", which is the expected package name for the \\\"MyMovies\\\" application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/database/FavoriteMovie.java\":\"This file defines a `FavoriteMovie` class that extends the `Movie` class. The `FavoriteMovie` class represents a movie that has been marked as a favorite by the user.\\n\\n`FavoriteMovie`: A class that represents a movie that has been marked as a favorite by the user.\\n\\n`FavoriteMovie(int, int, int, String, String, String, String, String, String, double, String)`: A constructor that initializes a `FavoriteMovie` object with the given parameters.\\n\\n`FavoriteMovie(Movie)`: A constructor that initializes a `FavoriteMovie` object by copying the properties of a `Movie` object.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It appears to be a document with some headings, including \\\"BestMovieTrailers\\\", \\\"desktop-tutorial\\\", and \\\"desktop-tutorial\\\". Based on the content, this file seems to be a document related to movie trailers and desktop tutorials, but without any specific class or function definitions.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mymovies/database/MovieDao.java\":\"This file defines a Data Access Object (DAO) interface for a movie database using Room, an Android architecture component for SQLite databases.\\n\\n`MovieDao`: An interface that defines the database operations for managing movies and favorite movies.\\n\\n`getAllMovie()`: Retrieves a list of all movies as a LiveData object.\\n`getAllFavoriteMovie()`: Retrieves a list of all favorite movies as a LiveData object.\\n`getMovieByIdSync(int movieId)`: Retrieves a single movie by its ID in a synchronous manner.\\n`getFavoriteMovieByIdSync(int movieId)`: Retrieves a single favorite movie by its ID in a synchronous manner.\\n`deleteAllMovies()`: Deletes all movies from the database.\\n`insertMovie(Movie... movies)`: Inserts one or more movies into the database.\\n`deleteMovie(Movie movie)`: Deletes a single movie from the database.\\n`insertFavoriteMovie(FavoriteMovie movies)`: Inserts a favorite movie into the database.\\n`deleteFavoriteMovie(FavoriteMovie movie)`: Deletes a favorite movie from the database.\"}"}
